event.title: dates back to the early 16th century A.D.

data.event: The discovery of the advancing communities of Palo dates back to the early 16th century A.D. along the banks of Bangon River.

event.title: centuries, some other settlements were formed

data.event: From the 14th to the 16th centuries, some other settlements were formed which also became the succeeding names of Palo, until finally in 1550 Don Miguel Lopez de Legaspi coalesced the settlements and named the new confederation "Palo".

event.title: became the succeeding names of Palo, until finally in 1550

data.event: From the 14th to the 16th centuries, some other settlements were formed which also became the succeeding names of Palo, until finally in 1550 Don Miguel Lopez de Legaspi coalesced the settlements and named the new confederation "Palo".
Palo formally became a town in 1768 with Kapitan Balasabas as its first administration.
